parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.55

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Positions

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the terrain height above the sea for the given position.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[getTerrainHeightASL]] position

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> position: [[Position2D]] or [[Position3D]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_height = [[getTerrainHeightASL]] ([[position]] [[player]]);</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_height = [[getTerrainHeightASL]] [5213,3245];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_seadepth = [[abs]] ([[getTerrainHeightASL]] [[getPos]] [[player]]); <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>sea depth at players position;</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setPosASL]], [[getPosASL]], [[getPosATL]], [[ASLToATL]], [[ATLToASL]]
</value></part></template>


[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma2</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
[[Category:Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead: New Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 6, 2017 - 20:02 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tankbuster|Tankbuster]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command can usefully return the depth of water at the given position when in water. Note that the number it returns is the depth, albiet expressed as a negative number. Use [[abs]] to always return a positive number. See example 3

</dd>
</dl>
